alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 05 at 2:12PM PST until January 08 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM SATURDAY TO 6 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves up to 7 to 10 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches, largest on west facing shores. * WHEN...From 2 AM Saturday to 6 AM PST Monday, largest Sunday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. STAY OFF THE ROCKS. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Enhanced beach erosion is also possible with minor beach flooding, especially around the Sunday 6am high tide.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
